description: Numbers n such that the number of distinct primes dividing n is a square.
links: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
example: 8 = 2^3 is divisible by just one (distinct) prime, 2 and 1 is a square, so 8 is in the sequence.
crossrefs: Differs from A000961 at a(62) = 210, etc.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
